etymology.description: semantic 土(土) (tǔ, "soil") + phonetic 成(成) (chéng, "complete") = city walls made of stamped earth -> wall; city wall
etymology.interpretation: The character 城(城) (chéng, "wall; city wall") combines the meaning of 土(土) (tǔ, "soil") with the sound of 成(成) (chéng, "complete"), reflecting the construction of city walls using compacted earth.

examples.chinese: 城外有护城河(城外有護城河)，城内居住百姓(城內居住百姓)。
examples.pinyin: Chéng wài yǒu hùchénghé, chéng nèi jūzhù bǎixìng。
examples.english: Outside the city wall there is a moat, and inside the city wall many people live.

examples.chinese: 古城历经岁月(古城歷經歲月)。
examples.english: The ancient city wall has endured the passage of time.

examples.chinese: 高耸的城令敌人畏惧(高聳的城令敵人畏懼)。
examples.pinyin: Gāosǒng de chéng lìng dírén wèijù。
examples.english: The towering city wall strikes fear into the hearts of enemies.
